basics.name: Il Ung Jeong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2019.

highlights: Analyze and build interfaces for the Department of Educationâ€™s legacy payroll system.
Develop and optimize large Oracle SQL queries aggregating HR data for over 360,000 employees.
Migrate business logic in COBOL programs to backend written in C# using Microsoft technologies such as Visual Studio and SQL Server Management Studio.

work.company: William S. Richardson School of Law
highlights: Provide consulting services for a digital archive that received international recognition by the Association of Tribal Archives, Libraries & Museums.
Develop a Java console application used to extract and compile metadata for over 190,000 digitized native Hawaiian records and legal documents.
Assist research for a power quality project at the Department of Information and Computer Sciences by developing daemons and utilities for key cloud services.
Develop test fixtures and practice continuous integration and deployment.
Secure serialized data sent across distributed systems.

awards.title: People's Choice Award
awards.summary: My team represented the State of Hawaii at the 2017 NASA Space Apps Challenge.

awards.title: Best UI/UX Award
awards.summary: My team won the Best UI/UX Award at the 2017 AT&T Hackathon.

awards.title: Best College Team Award
awards.summary: My team won the Best College Team at the 2017 Hawaii Annual Code Challenge.
